Subject:: SAQ2023723798 - 2023MY Bronco (U725) - Stop Build, Quarter Glass Poor Retention at D-Pilar - Soft Top Roof, All Markets - Alert Open
As Approved By:: Ali Jammoul, Todd Kloeb, Khaled Ayyash
Root Cause Owner/Org:: Supplier Quality / Webasto GG86C / Joel Brown - Site SAT Manager
Background/Concern Description:: IssuStop ship being requested for Webasto Soft Tops due to a poor fit, install and functional issue of the D pillar to rear quarter windows. Upon functioning the easy load, the rear quarter windows may improperly function by popping out of their retaining features.e tolling campaign Stop Ship at MAP to contain vehicles that may exhibit soft top quarter glass retention issue.
Interim Corrective Action (ICA):: Issue tolling campaign Stop Ship at MAP to contain vehicles that may exhibit soft top quarter glass retention issue.
Status/Next Steps:: Develop ICA to contain defects entering the line, and ICA to rework bad parts at MAP. Continue ICA and Root Cause investigation at Webasto Plymonth and Webasto Puebla. Corrective action of chamfering the quarter window clip was trialed on 02 Man, but the trial was not successful. Team approved Stop Build for this condition while corrective action is under investigation. Second corrective action under investigation and review with S. Ritter. Second action has completed all engineering specified testing / validation and approved to proceed by Khaled Ayyash. Stop Build is lifted, as technical solution has been identified, and returned to a Type 2 Stop Ship. Stop Build is being issued a second time as the corrective action implemented as MAP has failed in-system again. Stop Build re-isued.

Second action has completed all engineering specified testing / validation and approved to proceed by Khaled Ayyash. Stop Build is lifted, as technical solution has been identified, and returned to a Type 2 Stop Ship. Stop Build is being issued a second time as the corrective action implemented as MAP has failed in-system again. Stop Build re-isued.
